image.altText: Australia batter Pat Cummins shouts in joy after winning an Ashes Test at Edgbaston.

items.synopsis: Pat Cummins leads Australia to a stunning victory in the first Ashes Test, chasing down 281 with just two wickets left inside the final five overs at Edgbaston.

title.children: Pat Cummins leads Australia to miraculous Ashes victory with thrilling run chase at Edgbaston

image.altText: police crash investigators inspect the  road at the site of a crash

items.synopsis: The NSW government orders its Bus Industry Taskforce to review concerns around seat belt use, driver training and fatigue and safety management.

title.children: Urgent review ordered into NSW bus safety after fatal Hunter Valley crash

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man with a guitar and a white shirt with blood stains

items.synopsis: An inquiry hears a NSW Police task force ruled there was "insufficient information" to establish whether the former AC/DC manager's death was a hate crime but had not tested his blood-stained clothes.

title.children: Former AC/DC manager Crispin Dye's bloody clothes weren't tested through three police probes and a coronial inquest

image.altText: A road sign showing kangaroos in the area.

items.synopsis: Commercial kangaroo shooters are regulated under a national code that's supposed to protect animal welfare, but activists say what happens in rural Australia at night can be in breach and cruel. As global sportswear brands and US politicians move to phase out the use of kangaroo leather, exporters are fighting to protect their industry.

title.children: 'Alive and suffering': Commercial roo shooters accused of animal cruelty

image.altText: Black and white photograph of a man playing the guitar with long hair

items.synopsis: Crispin Dye's case, which was due to be revisited today at an inquiry, has now been delayed after a judge described NSW Police record keeping as "borderline shambolic".

title.children: New evidence about brutal death of AC/DC manager uncovered during gay hate inquiry

image.altText: Daniel Mookhey

items.synopsis: The state's budget was due for a $300 million surplus next year but Daniel Mookhey says it will now be "very hard to hit those figures".

title.children: 'Very difficult': NSW treasurer says state budget surplus unlikely amid inflation, cost blow-outs

image.altText: A cylindrical white metal underwater craft floats in a dark blue mass of water.

items.synopsis: Search efforts are continuing for five people missing in a deep-ocean submersible in the northern Atlantic, with rescuers in a race against time as oxygen levels dwindle.

title.children: Forty hours of breathable air left as US Coast Guard launches new vessel to search for lost submersible

image.altText: Xi Jinping standing in front of a Chinese flag.

items.synopsis: A major new opinion poll shows Australians have warmed slightly to China over the past year, while a majority are glad to see high-level political contact resume between Canberra and Beijing.

title.children: Poll finds most Australians glad relations with China thawing, but still don't trust Xi Jinping

image.altText: Aerial view of rows of new houses in outer suburbia.

items.synopsis: Banks and financial counsellors are urging borrowers to take action before they miss home loan repayments. Here are some of the options you might have if it's becoming difficult to keep up with your mortgage.

title.children: What to do if you're struggling to make your home loan repayments

image.altText: Lea Russ lying in a hospital bed, with multiple IV tubes hooked up to one arm.

items.synopsis: Patients who need to see a GP urgently are increasingly waiting more than 24 hours to be seen. But they may not know that general practices are meant to offer emergency bookings.

title.children: Getting a GP appointment is hard; getting an urgent one is even harder

image.altText: A woman in a coma lies in a hospital bed

items.synopsis: Kylee Enwright is back in her home community after falling and hitting her head 10 hours into a Thailand holiday with her husband.

title.children: NSW woman flown home from Thailand after 'terrible' holiday accident

image.altText: A older man smiles while looking at a younger man

items.synopsis: US President Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden agrees to plead guilty on three federal tax and firearm charges in a deal with the Justice Department.

title.children: Hunter Biden takes plea deal on federal tax and firearm charges

image.altText: Indigenous rock art painting of hands and a kookaburra in a cave at Carnarvon Gorge

items.synopsis: Indigenous leaders and local rangers say the lengths people will go to for the perfect photograph at Carnarvon Gorge are disrespectful and unlawful.

title.children: Social media influencers ruining ancient Indigenous art at Carnarvon Gorge, rangers say

image.altText: Police officers walking next to Andrew Tate in a blue hooded jumper

items.synopsis: Romanian prosecutors send social media influencer Andrew Tate, his brother Tristan, and two other suspects to trial on charges of human trafficking and forming a criminal gang to sexually exploit women.

title.children: Social media personality Andrew Tate to face trial for rape and human trafficking

image.altText: Australian currency is seen next to a wages graph

items.synopsis: The stock market is a few percentage points away from an all-time high because some of Australia's biggest corporations are making record profits. But Australian households are under pressure, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The Reserve Bank has pointed directly to the elephant in the room

image.altText: A western man extends his hand and walks towards a taller Chinese man in a conference room

items.synopsis: Despite the first visit to Beijing of a US secretary of state in almost five years, there were signs that China was less than enthusiastic about welcoming Antony Blinken. Here are the key takeaways from the two-day visit.

title.children: 'Xi wanted the upper hand': Five takeaways from the China-US talks in Beijing

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

items.synopsis: Australia's largest regional and domestic airline operator says they've been challenged by global shortages in crews and parts despite rebounds in post-COVID operations.

title.children: Once optimistic Rex Airlines forecasts $35 million in losses for financial year

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie and Glenn Kolomeitz stand in front of microphones at a press conference inside Parliament House

items.synopsis: Tasmanian senator Jacqui Lambie has requested the International Criminal Court investigate senior Australian Defence Force commanders over their knowledge of alleged war crimes in Afghanistan.

title.children: Lambie demands The Hague investigate Australian top brass over knowledge of war crimes

image.altText: A man stands in front of a beer taps inside a brewery.

items.synopsis: A craft brewery on the New South Wales' Mid North Coast is the latest to shut its doors, as the industry faces increasing financial pressures as craft beer becomes a luxury good.

title.children: Craft beer breweries buckle as 'luxury' beverages struggle under rising costs

image.altText: Thorpe holds a phone up for Hargraves as he reads a message from it to journalists.

items.synopsis: Independent senator Lidia Thorpe gives her full support to the No case for the Voice to Parliament, following what she called a breakdown in negotiations with government on Indigenous justice.

title.children: Lidia Thorpe announces she will be backing No campaign against Indigenous Voice

image.altText: A composite picture with portraits of MP Cindy McLeish and Premier Daniel Andrews.

items.synopsis: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews refuses to apologise to Liberal MP Cindy McLeish after being accused of referring to her as a "half-wit grub" during a rowdy parliamentary sitting.

title.children: Victorian premier refuses to apologise to female Liberal MP over 'half-wit grub' comment

image.altText: Outside shot of a cream and brick art deco building with white columns, the words court house on the facade

items.synopsis: A WA couple has been refused bail after allegedly stealing a tractor, erratically driving 80km along a Victorian highway and crashing into the fence of Puckapunyal Army Base.

title.children: WA couple allegedly steals $150k tractor, crashes into army base fence

items.synopsis: An inquest into the death of a cyclist hit by a four-wheel drive on an SA highway hears a recommendation to annually re-test the driver — who was visually impaired after a stroke — was ignored.

title.children: 'Red flags' about driver's visual impairment ignored before cyclist fatally hit, inquest told

image.altText: A view shows the Pulse building, the headquarters of the Paris 2024 Olympics organising committee,.

items.synopsis: The headquarters of the Paris 2024 Olympics organising committee and those of its infrastructure partner have been searched by police as part of investigations into alleged embezzlement.

title.children: Police raid Paris 2024 Olympics headquarters amid embezzlement investigation

image.altText: A still image from the original film shows a robot woman with waves over her head in black and white.

items.synopsis: Universal Studious cancels a major production for TV series Metropolis that was set to employ hundreds, citing fallout from the US writers' strike

title.children: Universal Studios pulls the plug on major TV series Metropolis to be filmed in Melbourne

image.altText: Plane crashed into bushes

items.synopsis: One person has been seriously injured after a light plane crash near Derby.

title.children: Authorities investigating light plane crash in WA's far north

image.altText: A male and a female ballet dancer strike a pose on stage

items.synopsis: After a stunning career that became the bestselling book and film, Mao's Last Dancer, the artistic director of the Queensland Ballet, Li Cunxin, has announced his plans to step away for good amid health concerns.

title.children: Mao's Last Dancer to step down after stunning career amid health concerns

image.altText: Do Kwon, a Korean man with short hair wearing a blue shirt, in a video still.

items.synopsis: Authorities in Montenegro say Do Kwon, who is wanted on allegations of fraud and financial crimes, tried to fly to Dubai using a fake Costa Rican passport.

title.children: Founder of cryptocurrency firm Terraform Labs imprisoned for forging documents

image.altText: An empty synthetic turf field.

items.synopsis: The number of artificial turf sports fields in NSW has increased from 30 in 2018 to 181 at last count, concerning community groups about their potential environmental impact.

title.children: The EU has banned synthetic turf that uses old tyres. Why isn't Australia following suit?

image.altText: Frost builds up on a fence post

items.synopsis: Winter solstice is only a few days away but it doesn't mark the beginning of winter in Australia. It also doesn't mark the middle of winter or even the coldest day of the year.

title.children: Thursday will be the shortest day of the year — here's why that might seem out of sync with the seasons

image.altText: A powhiri ceremony at the marae of the Te Papa museum in Wellington.

items.synopsis: Snatched by grave robbers or traded by settlers as macabre curiosities, the remains of New Zealand's Indigenous people are slowly being brought home after centuries overseas.

title.children: 'Like a crime ring': New Zealand brings home stolen, traded Indigenous remains
